name: The Untold Story of Grasses
description:
How have grasses shaped human civilisation and the ecosystem?

Grasses are an ancient, diverse and extraordinary group of plants, but most of us rarely give them a second thought. Join Mahesh Sankaran as he explores how their evolution has transformed Earth in unprecedented ways, and how these amazing life forms impact our lives in ways we don’t realise. The discussion will conclude by outlining the various dangers that grassland ecosystems are currently experiencing and stressing how vital it is that they be preserved.

This programme is organised in collaboration with the Infosys Science Foundation.

name: Recasting the Iron Age: Coastal Tamil Urn Burial Sites and Harappan Links
description:
Have we rewritten the history of the Iron Age?

Recent Accelerator Mass Spectrometry (AMS) dates from coastal urn burial sites of Sivagalai and Adichnallur in Tamil Nadu have pushed back the timeline for the early finds of iron. Evidence indicates the use of iron emerged as early as about 3000 BCE, suggesting people and technology could have moved between Tamil Nadu and Harappan sites. In this lecture, archaeometallurgist Sharada Srinivasan will share ongoing research which enables us to rethink the first use of iron from an archaeometallurgical perspective. Using burial urns as a central motif, she will share contemporary theories and evidence to show how these discoveries of iron in Tamil Nadu might reshape our understanding of the emergence of iron and technologies around smelting.

name: Rehearsing Duality
description: Artists Rohini Devasher & Elisa Storelli will set up an experiment to posit / prove alternative frames of collaboration between art and science. The title takes its name from two intertwined ideas, the ‘rehearsal’ and ‘duality’ or that which is shaped by the quality of ‘two’. Building on projects centered on chronology and observation, they will explore the format of a staging to frame working methodologies created by the intersections, collisions and amplification of individual thinking.

name: Lessons from the Land
description:
From agriculture and real estate to mining and conservation, land is constantly being reordered in ways that are often contested and complex. As rural worlds become disembedded and de-agrarianisation takes hold, what gets left behind? This shift brings with it the loss of symbiotic relationships with land, traditional knowledge systems, cultural life-worlds, and a deep sense of belonging.

Join A R Vasavi for as she explores how shifting land use is reshaping our environments, identities, and ways of life in the contemporary world.

This programme is in collaboration with Infosys Science Foundation.

name: Dear Earth, It's Complicated: Sci560 Exhibition Walkthrough
description:
How often do we stop to smell flowers, hear birdsongs, or hug trees in Namma Garden City? Has it always been like this?

How has our relationship with the Earth changed over the past few decades? Where do we fall in its intricate web of life?

Join our mediators, Aslaha and Gaayatri for a guided walkthrough of the Sci560 exhibition, where we will reflect on our evolving connection with the Earth.

name: Behind the Buzz: Rethinking Data Science Today
description:
Data science has become a buzzword as a way of providing solutions to all kinds of problems. Today, there is a lot of speculation around technology, especially data science.
However, is data science still festering older biases? How much can we trust the solutions provided? How dependent are we becoming on data science?

While it is true that data science can solve challenging problems, concerns remain that it is equally vulnerable to arriving at erroneous conclusions and can be subjected to methodological abuse.

Join Jayant Harista for a thought provoking lecture pushing the conversation around data science in the contemporary world.

This programme is in collaboration with Infosys Science Foundation.

name: Visit to the Artist’s Home-Studio

location.name:
19/18, First Cross, First Main Road
Jayamahal Extension,
Bangalore 560046
location.address:
19/18, First Cross, First Main Road
Jayamahal Extension,
Bangalore 560046, Bangalore

description:
What stories are forged in the heat of metal and memory?
Step inside the artist studio of Balan Nambiar, surrounded by the tools of his craft, molten materials, and decades of documentation. With a practice rooted in metal casting, photography, and ethnographic research, Balan explores folk traditions and how these inform his sculptural forms.
Through this visit, participants will explore how studios can become a space for cultural memory, experimentation, and hybrid knowledge systems.
